configuration.apex-ls-ts.trace.server.de: Traces the communication between VS Code and the Apex-LS-TS Language Server (Typescript)
configuration.apex-ls-ts.debug.descripti: Debug mode for the Apex-LS-TS language server. 'inspect' enables debugging without breaking, 'inspect-brk' enables debugging with break on start
configuration.apex-ls-ts.debugPort.descr: Port to use for debugging (6009 is the default)
configuration.apex-ls-ts.environment.ser: Server mode: 'production' = use production capabilities (limited features, optimized performance), 'development' = use development capabilities (all features enabled including hover, completion, etc.). Can be overridden by APEX_LS_MODE environment variable. Defaults to extension mode if not specified.
configuration.apex-ls-ts.commentCollecti: Enable comment collection during document parsing
Associate comments with symbols for enhanced language features (may impact performance)
Enable comment collection for document change events
Enable comment collection for document open events
Enable comment collection for document symbols (may impact performance)
Enable comment collection for folding ranges (may impact performance)
configuration.apex-ls-ts.performance.com: Maximum file size (in bytes) for comment collection. Files larger than this will skip comment collection for performance.
configuration.apex-ls-ts.performance.use: Use asynchronous comment processing to improve performance
configuration.apex-ls-ts.performance.doc: Debounce delay (in milliseconds) for document change processing
configuration.apex-ls-ts.environment.pro: Profiling mode: 'none' = disabled, 'full' = continuous profiling from startup using Node.js flags, 'interactive' = manual start/stop using inspector API (desktop only)
Type of profiling to perform when profiling is enabled. Options: 'cpu' for CPU profiling, 'heap' for heap profiling, or 'both' for both (desktop only)
Optional tag to add to profiling filenames when stopping profiling via toggle. Leave empty for no tag. Can be set via Profile Options menu or settings.
configuration.apex-ls-ts.environment.jsH: JavaScript heap size in GB for the language server process. If not specified, Node.js default heap size is used. Maximum allowed value is 32 GB. Values above 16 GB may cause performance issues if system memory is insufficient.
configuration.apex-ls-ts.environment.add: Additional document schemes to include in document selectors. Default schemes (file, apexlib, vscode-test-web) are immutable and always included. Additional schemes apply to all LSP capabilities by default. Use excludeCapabilities to exclude specific capabilities from a scheme.
The URI scheme name to add (e.g., 'custom-scheme')
Optional array of LSP capability names to exclude this scheme from. Valid capabilities: documentSymbol, hover, foldingRange, diagnostic, completion, definition, codeLens, executeCommand
configuration.apex-ls-ts.resources.loadM: Resource loading mode for Apex-LS-TS standard library files. 'full' loads all resources immediately (faster access, higher memory usage), 'lazy' loads resources on-demand (lower memory usage, slight access delay)
configuration.apex-ls-ts.logLevel.descri: Controls the minimum log level for Apex-LS-TS Language Server logging. Messages at this level or higher will be logged.
configuration.apex-ls-ts.worker.logCateg: Categories of worker logs to show
configuration.apex-ls-ts.custom.descript: Custom configuration for the Apex Language Server
configuration.apex-ls-ts.findMissingArti: Missing artifact resolution settings. Controls server capability for apex/findMissingArtifact custom request.
Timeout for blocking resolution in milliseconds
Maximum number of candidate files to open
Default timeout hint sent to client
configuration.apex-ls-ts.loadWorkspace.d: Workspace loading settings. Controls automatic workspace loading and performance tuning.
configuration.apex-ls-ts.loadWorkspace.e: Enable automatic workspace loading at startup
configuration.apex-ls-ts.loadWorkspace.m: Maximum number of concurrent file operations during workspace loading
configuration.apex-ls-ts.loadWorkspace.y: Number of file operations before yielding control to prevent UI blocking
Delay in milliseconds when yielding control during workspace loading
configuration.apex-ls-ts.queueProcessing: Queue processing settings. Controls task scheduling and concurrency per priority level.
Maximum number of concurrent tasks per priority level
Maximum concurrent tasks for CRITICAL priority (ephemeral system tasks)
Maximum concurrent tasks for IMMEDIATE priority
Maximum concurrent tasks for HIGH priority
Maximum concurrent tasks for NORMAL priority
Maximum concurrent tasks for LOW priority
Maximum concurrent tasks for BACKGROUND priority

Optional overall maximum concurrent tasks across all priorities. When set, provides a safety net to prevent system overload. Default: sum of per-priority limits * 1.2 (20% buffer). When overall limit is exceeded, only lower priorities (Normal/Low/Background) are blocked. Critical/Immediate/High priorities are always allowed through to prevent priority inversion
Number of tasks processed before yielding control to prevent blocking
Delay in milliseconds when yielding control during queue processing
configuration.apex-ls-ts.scheduler.descr: Priority scheduler settings. Controls queue capacity and scheduling behavior.
configuration.apex-ls-ts.scheduler.queue: Queue capacity per priority level (maximum queue size)
Queue capacity for CRITICAL priority (ephemeral system tasks)
configuration.apex-ls-ts.scheduler.maxHi: Maximum number of high-priority tasks before starvation relief
configuration.apex-ls-ts.scheduler.idleS: Idle sleep duration in milliseconds when no tasks available
configuration.apex-ls-ts.scheduler.queue: Interval for periodic queue state notifications to client in milliseconds
configuration.apex-ls-ts.deferredReferen: Deferred reference processing settings. Controls retry behavior and circuit breaker thresholds.
Batch size for processing deferred references
Batch size for initial reference processing when adding symbol tables
Maximum number of retry attempts for deferred references
Maximum retry delay in milliseconds for exponential backoff
Queue capacity threshold percentage - don't retry if queue exceeds this percentage
Queue drain threshold percentage - only retry when queue is below this percentage
Delay in milliseconds when queue is full
Maximum delay in milliseconds when queue is full
Number of consecutive failures before activating circuit breaker
Queue capacity percentage threshold to reset circuit breaker
Rate limit for enqueueing deferred tasks per second

commands.apex.showAggregatedLogs.title: Show All Apex Logs
commands.apex-ls-ts.showGraph.title: Show Symbol Graph
commands.apex-ls-ts.showQueueState.title: Show Queue State Dashboard
commands.apex.profiling.start.title: Start Performance Profiling
commands.apex.profiling.stop.title: Stop Performance Profiling
commands.apex.profiling.status.title: Show Profiling Status
configuration.apex.title: Apex Language Server
